examples.first: Se trata de niños, jóvenes, adultos y ancianos con rostros macilentos y ojos llenos de tristeza y soledad.
examples.second: They are children, young people, adults and elderly persons with emaciated faces and sad, lonely eyes.

examples.first: Ahora, sobre una mitad del mundo, la naturaleza parece muerta...... y el macilento asesinato, alarmado por su centinela, el lobo...... cuyo aullido es su grito de guardia
examples.second: Now o' er the one half- world nature seems dead...... and withered murder, alarmed by his sentinel, the wolf...... whose howl' s his watch

examples.first: He intentado encontrar tu tono de piel, pero el kit no tiene " blanco macilento ".
examples.second: Uh, ok, so I tried to match your skin tone as best I could, bu t the kit doesn't have " pasty white. "

examples.first: Al salir, visitamos al niño; era como si sus ojos se le hubieran dado vuelta hacia atrás; no podía abrir los párpados; su rostro y sus orejas estaban macilentos y presentaban un tono pálido y frío, anunciando el cercano fin.
examples.second: As we departed, we called and saw the child; his eyeballs turned upwards: his eyelids fell and closed: his face and ears were thin, and wore the pale marble hue, indicative of approaching dissolution.

examples.first: Sangre exageradamente roja, mucosas macilentas, indicadores clave de envenenamiento cianhídrico.
examples.second: Two key indicators of hydrocyanic poisoning.

examples.first: Parece una vieja, arrugada, macilenta, flaca...
examples.second: She looks old, wrinkled, emaciated, skinny...

examples.first: Al macilento brillo De un cirio
Buckley, en cambio, tenía el aspecto macilento del hombre que acaba de cumplir una peligrosa misión de bombardeo.
examples.second: Buckley, on the other hand, had the haggard look of a man who had just completed a dangerous bombing mission.

examples.first: No quiero que estés macilenta y en luto perpetuo.
examples.second: I can't have you gray-faced and in perpetual mourning.
